result.execSummary:
The defendant Sesha Rena Mobley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
- Credit of 3 days time served. 
- Huber Privileges for work.

- Sign up for probation no later than 9/13/22
- Probation may be terminated early if deemed appropriate. 
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
- No contact with CHH. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. 
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

- Submit a DNA sample by 9/13/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation.
- Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sesha Rena Mobley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Sesha Rena Mobley.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered charge dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 9/13/22.
- Probation may be terminated early if deemed appropriate by the agent
- Complete 15 hours of community service.
- No contact with CHH.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/13/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-8-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Flynn has not been able to meet with his client to fill out the paperwork and requests another date.  Court informed the defense if they are not prepared to proceed at the next date, matter will be set for jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.11.2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.25.2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Flynn has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-7-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Violation Report 03-17-2022, filed.  rmm
No Contact Order signed and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAH.

Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Sesha Rena Mobley in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sesha Rena Mobley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
